action.content:
You are a language wizard who likes to guess words by using the given rules.

Welcome to Wordle! You have six attempts to guess the target word, a valid English word of five lowercase letters (a-z). Please use the tags "explanation:" and "guess:" to provide a concise explanation for each guess.

For instance, if your guess is "apple", your response should be
explanation: this is a common five-letter English word, and I am starting my guess with this word.
guess: apple

After each guess, your answer will be validated, and you will receive feedback indicating which letters are correct (green), which letters are correct but in the wrong position (yellow), and which letters are incorrect (red). This feedback can be useful in determining which letters to include or exclude in your next guess.

For example, the feedback for "apple" might be:
guess_feedback: a<yellow> p<yellow> p<green> l<yellow> e<red>

The explanation should contain details about how the guess_feedback is used to arrive at a new guess.

Do not generate any other text.

Let's begin with your first guess.

explanation: Starting with a common five-letter word to gather initial feedback on letter correctness and positioning.
guess: apple

attempts = 1
target_word = think
guess = apple
guess_feedback = a<red> p<red> p<red> l<red> e<red>

guess_feedback: a<red> p<red> p<red> l<red> e<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: All letters in "apple" are incorrect, so I will try a completely different set of letters, avoiding a, p, l, and e.
guess: round

attempts = 2
target_word = think
guess = round
guess_feedback = r<red> o<red> u<red> n<green> d<red>

guess_feedback: r<red> o<red> u<red> n<green> d<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The letter "n" is correct and in the right position. I will keep "n" in the fourth position and try new letters for the rest, avoiding r, o, u, and d.
guess: minty

attempts = 3
target_word = think
guess = minty
guess_feedback = m<red> i<yellow> n<yellow> t<yellow> y<red>

guess_feedback: m<red> i<yellow> n<yellow> t<yellow> y<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The letters i, n, and t are correct but misplaced. I will rearrange them and try new letters for the other positions, avoiding m and y.
guess: stint

attempts = 4
target_word = think
guess = stint
guess_feedback = s<red> t<yellow> i<green> n<green> t<red>

guess_feedback: s<red> t<yellow> i<green> n<green> t<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The letters "i" and "n" are correct and in the right positions. The letter "t" is correct but misplaced. I will keep "i" and "n" in their positions, move "t" to a new position, and try new letters for the rest, avoiding s.
guess: twain

attempts = 5
target_word = think
guess = twain
guess_feedback = t<green> w<red> a<red> i<yellow> n<yellow>

guess_feedback: t<green> w<red> a<red> i<yellow> n<yellow>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The letter "t" is correct and in the right position. The letters "i" and "n" are correct but misplaced. I will keep "t" in the first position, rearrange "i" and "n", and try new letters for the other positions, avoiding w and a.
guess: tunic

attempts = 6
target_word = think
guess = tunic
guess_feedback = t<green> u<red> n<yellow> i<yellow> c<red>

guess_explanation: Starting with a common five-letter word to gather initial feedback on letter correctness and positioning.
All letters in "apple" are incorrect, so I will try a completely different set of letters, avoiding a, p, l, and e.
The letter "n" is correct and in the right position. I will keep "n" in the fourth position and try new letters for the rest, avoiding r, o, u, and d.
The letters i, n, and t are correct but misplaced. I will rearrange them and try new letters for the other positions, avoiding m and y.

The letters "i" and "n" are correct and in the right positions. The letter "t" is correct but misplaced. I will keep "i" and "n" in their positions, move "t" to a new position, and try new letters for the rest, avoiding s.

The letter "t" is correct and in the right position. The letters "i" and "n" are correct but misplaced. I will keep "t" in the first position, rearrange "i" and "n", and try new letters for the other positions, avoiding w and a.
